messages.message:
Not necessarily sure where to make this ask but- for AI Hub, have we been testing other models to use besides just GPT? Citi is asking if this is our product direction to be multi-model, and if so they are willing to partner with us on this initiative and doing any comparison work, etc.

Per our champion, Tod, they are specifically interested in Gemini and Claude.. and Citi has also approved Llama3 and Mistral. They have concerns with OpenAI as they just found an increasing amount of vulnerabilities in GPT 4o. Any product / leadership help here would be greatly appreciated as we are trying to close the SaaS/AI Hub deal with Citi by 12/10. Thanks!

Yeah internally we have plans to benchmark with Claude (have done so in the past with good results). However our engineering plumbing and testing setup isn't there as far as I understand. However, will let Clemens respond here with more detail on sales cycle here. How strong of a request is this @Kyra Harney? (External voiceover here (https://docs.google.com/document/d/166UscQVmHIHFIL3aOXK_PuQUTnskNSU9QNm3zuMcQz8/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.dxmlu1856sx8)
as you probably have seen)
happy to chat with them if it helps
and we'll create some enablement material once we have hooked up those other models and have more insights

thanks, all! @Clemens would be great to connect you with Tod on this. because their concern is that once they buy AI Hub / SaaS, they then have a lengthy security and “AI OC” (think AI counsel) for any production models, and he flagged that GPT 4o could potentially get get blocked at Citi. Would be great for you and him to connect directly to form the relationship, and discuss the long term product vision to hook up other models, and how/if Citi can be part of that process (if it’s helpful for us)
